name: Daniel Meruelo
title: Professor of Pathology
summary: Our lab focuses on creating a novel cancer treatment platform using the oncolytic Sindbis viral vector (SV) engineered from Sindbis Virus.

name: Jane Skok
title: Sandra and Edward Meyer Professor of Radiation Oncology
summary: To uncover how CTCF/CTCFL, cohesin, transcription factors, and nucleosomes generate tunable insulation and state-specific 3D genome folding.

name: Ran Brosh
title: Research Assistant Professor, Associate Director
summary: I have two roles: [1] as Faculty at ISG/Pathology I am leading the Dark Matter Project, a collaborative effort to use synthetic biology and genome writing to study the noncoding genome and its roles in health and disease.
keywords: ACE2 humanized mouse models; Big IN platform; CRISPR activation rescue; DHS element function mapping; SARS CoV 2 susceptibility models; SVA retrotransposon biology; Sox2 locus control region; TAF1 humanization; X linked dystonia parkinsonism; capture sequencing validation; chromatin and transcriptome profiling; landing pad based genome rewriting; large DNA payload integration; locus scale genome engineering; mSwAP In iterative rewriting; mammalian genome writing; synthetic regulatory genomics

name: Richard Possemato
title: Associate Professor
summary: I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Pathology at NYU School of Medicine and Co-Leader of the Cancer Cell Biology Program at the Perlmutter Cancer Center.

name: Susan Smith
title: Professor
summary: My laboratory studies mechanisms of chromosome cohesion and segregation in human normal cells, stem cells, aging cells, and cancer cells.
